TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CustomizeLegendEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CustomizeLegendEventArgs class is used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CustomizeLegend> event.
There are only two properties in this class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomizeLegendEventArgs.LegendItems%2A> property allows you to delete or modify both default and custom legend items, and to add custom legend items. This property can also be used to change the order of legend items.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomizeLegendEventArgs.LegendName%2A> property is used to identify the legend that raised this event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItemsCollection legendItems) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItemsCollection legendItems, string legendName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified and legend name.
Used to remove, modify or change the order of both custom and default legend items in the event. Can also be used to add custom legend items.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The LegendItems property allows you to delete or modify both default and custom legend items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CustomizeLegend> event, and to add custom legend items. The order of legend items can also be changed.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItem.SeriesPointIndex%2A> and [LegendItem.SeriesPointIndex](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) properties can be used to determine the data element that is associated with a default legend item. These properties will return zero-length strings for custom legend items, because custom items are not associated with chart data.
This property enables you to determine which <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend> the event was raised for, which enables you to customize an individual [Legend](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the object, which can be used to determine which legend was the sender of the event.
Docs.value: A value that represents the name of the associated object.
